evidences.text: What's not on here is English lit, so we can talk a little bit about that.
I was looking into why it performs poorly on literature on earlier versions of ChatGPT, but it's been corrected recently and what kind of job it does.
I'm not a very big literature person, I don't know who that is, but I took her poem monologue for St. Louis and I asked for a text based analysis straight out of the AP test.
And then at the end, what this newer version does is it says, hey, if you want, I can make you a device and effect chart for this poem so you can pull evidence quickly for any AP lit imagery essay.
It would break down imagery symbols of all different things with matching quotes.
It gave me this cheat sheet for the whole poem, telling me what each different piece is and which device kind of represents and what the effect is and what I'm supposed to feel from it.
And it said, hey, how about I map the poem's emotional stanza arc by arc or stanza by stanza and show you where they shift tone.
It completely broke it apart for me.
It said, hey, I can make this in a ready to use template.
You can plug in, create a top scoring essay, a roadmap.
Plug and play commentary phrases that work well so it sounds you sound analytical and precise without wasting time thinking of phrasing during the exam.
It basically gave you all the imagery, all the devices, and told you what all the metaphors meant.
It can read poems that I can't understand, so it's better than me.
